examples: The five candidates spent almost the entire debate ahead of the primaries trading punches.
The Red Cross's primary concern is to preserve and protect human life.
English is the primary language spoken in the United States.
Euglena serves as a primary producer, contributing to the food chain in aquatic ecosystems.
Tax reform was one of the new president's primary campaign promises, but it will likely prove a hard row to hoe, given the deep divisions in congress.
words.defineEn: having the most importance or influence
words.defineVi: có tầm quan trọng nhất hoặc ảnh hưởng

examples: At this stage in the campaign, the Democratic candidate is way ahead of the pack.
In a democratic society, the voice of the people is the voice of God, and it is the duty of the government to listen to and respect the will of the majority.
Clinton also had two personal strikes against him as he went into the home stretch toward the July Democratic convention.
In a democratic society, it is important to create a level playing field for all political candidates, ensuring fair and equal opportunities for campaigning and participating in elections.
It's all enough to make Democratic strategists who focus on communities of color feel as if they are caught in a time warp.
words.defineEn: marked by the characteristics of democracy
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bởi các đặc điểm của nền dân chủ

examples: A reporter obtained documents from the company under false pretenses.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
He shared false information without verifying its accuracy.
She received false advice that led to negative consequences.
She received a false promise that was never fulfilled.
words.defineEn: not according to reality or facts
words.defineVi: không theo thực tế hoặc sự kiện

examples: The journey home through the storm was absolute murder!
For all younger people in the US saving for retirement will be an absolute necessity.
For years he was an absolute penny-pincher.
Too many companies reckon without the pitfalls that make insurance like this an absolute necessity.
Peter noticed throughout history how rulers who were granted immense power often became tyrannical and cruel, proving that absolute power corrupts absolutely.
words.defineEn: complete and total, or free from any imperfection
words.defineVi: đầy đủ và toàn bộ, hoặc không có bất kỳ sự không hoàn hảo nào

examples: The museum had an impressive collection of European art.
The new mansion looked impressive, but something was missing.
The basketball player's impressive shooting skills were hitting opponents out of the park, scoring multiple three-point shots and leading his team to a victory.
What they promise sounds impressive enough - let's see if they come up with the goods.
He's an impressive player to watch, but he's all brawn and no brain.
words.defineEn: causing admiration because of size, skill, importance, etc.
words.defineVi: gây ngưỡng mộ vì quy mô, kỹ năng, tầm quan trọng, v.v.

examples: The west is home to vast deserts, rolling plains, and majestic mountain ranges.
Canada is a vast country known for its stunning landscapes and friendly people.
My grandmother collects porcelain dolls and has a vast display in her living room.
The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
The Sargasso Sea is renowned for its vast floating mats of Sargasso seaweed.
words.defineEn: very great in size or amount
words.defineVi: rất lớn về kích thước hoặc số lượng

examples: The referee in the firing line is an experienced official.
Officials there insist they have no hidden agenda.
But officials deny they've been keeping their proposals under wraps.
Officials are urging residents not to try to weather the storm.
Buckingham Palace in London is the official residence of the Queen of the United Kingdom.
words.defineEn: relating to a person with authority
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một người có thẩm quyền

examples: Keep a sharp lookout for David.
With a sharp knife, the chef expertly removed the gristle from the pork chops.
He remained sharp as a tack.
She felt a sharp pain in her hand.
He's as sharp as a tack.
words.defineEn: having a point or edge that can pierce or cut something
words.defineVi: có một điểm hoặc cạnh có thể đâm hoặc cắt một cái gì đó

examples: As for the groundless accusations of certain Western media, I can only say that they are measuring other people's corn by their own bushel.

"I love western films!"
In western Siberia, many people have a missing DNA letter in position 35 of the GJB2 gene.
Hey fun fact, though: the western hemisphere has water too.
words.defineEn: directed toward or located in the west
words.defineVi: hướng về phía hoặc nằm ở phía tây

examples: But the lawyers also described internal politics that at times slowed down the department's work or drove a wedge among members of the team.
You have internal energy.
Internal energy is 0.
Monarch butterflies actually have two internal clocks.
Monarch butterflies actually have two internal clocks.
words.defineEn: located in or related to the inside of something
words.defineVi: nằm trong hoặc liên quan đến bên trong của một cái gì đó

examples: The study analyzed the yield of various crops across different regions, providing valuable insights for agricultural planning.
Leaving your valuables in plain sight in your car is asking for a break-in.
He was able to abstract valuable insights from the extensive research.

The business owner reflected on his own youthful mistakes, acknowledging that wanton kittens make sober cats, and that his early errors had taught him valuable lessons that he applied to his business practices.
Did the burglars take anything valuable?
words.defineEn: worth a large amount of money
words.defineVi: trị giá một số tiền lớn

examples: The proposal was dropped after opposition from civil liberties groups.
When it comes to civil rights issues, Mary is always eager to take up the gauntlet.
Although she was angry, she kept a civil tongue.

Whether we're talking to our friends, family, or coworkers, we should keep in mind that a civil question deserves a civil answer, and that being kind and considerate can go a long way in fostering positive relationships.

Whether we're talking to our friends, family, or coworkers, we should keep in mind that a civil question deserves a civil answer, and that being kind and considerate can go a long way in fostering positive relationships.
words.defineEn: related to the citizens of a country
words.defineVi: liên quan đến công dân của một quốc gia

examples: Here, wet your whistle.
He's still wet behind the ears!
You're all wet Jameson
I may be all wet on this point.
He sounds about as much fun as a wet weekend in Carmarthenshire.
words.defineEn: covered with or full of water or another liquid
words.defineVi: được bao phủ bởi hoặc đầy nước hoặc chất lỏng khác

examples: The east is known for its rich cultural heritage.
This is one of our top cultural projects, for which we are putting our shoulders to the wheel with great enthusiasm.

I enjoy attending cultural events like concerts or theater performances on Saturdays.
London is the capital city of the United Kingdom and a major cultural and economic hub.
words.defineEn: involving a society's culture, traditions, beliefs, and other related matters
words.defineVi: liên quan đến văn hóa, truyền thống, tín ngưỡng của một xã hội và các vấn đề liên quan khác

examples: Biology and computing are disciplines which seem like chalk and cheese but which have very deep connections on the most fundamental level.

The society believed that education was a fundamental human right, knowing that better unborn than untaught - it was essential to ensure that everyone had the opportunity to reach their full potential.
First off is the fundamentals.
So your fundamental frequency stays, well, fundamental.
So people no longer care about fundamentals.
words.defineEn: impacting the core and most important parts of something; the most basic or important
words.defineVi: tác động đến phần cốt lõi và quan trọng nhất của một cái gì đó; cơ bản nhất hoặc quan trọng nhất

examples: The adventurer used the tail fat as a survival resource during their journey in the wilderness.
The fat is in the fire now, huh?

words.defineEn: (of people or animals) weighing much more than what is thought to be healthy for their body
words.defineVi: (của người hoặc động vật) nặng hơn nhiều so với những gì được cho là lành mạnh cho cơ thể của họ

examples: He bought pure maple syrup from a local farm.

words.defineEn: not combined or mixed with anything else
words.defineVi: không kết hợp hoặc pha trộn với bất cứ điều gì khác

examples: For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.

The successful entrepreneur knew that money makes money and used his initial profits to fund new business ventures that eventually made him a millionaire.

words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc xảy ra lúc đầu

examples: The city has put the brakes on further spending.

words.defineEn: to a greater extent

examples: She stopped the car opposite the school.

words.defineVi: ở phía bên kia của một khu vực khi nhìn từ một điểm thuận lợi cụ thể

examples: Unlike the other Celtic tribes, Roman legions have no regard for the druids’ sacred role as peacemakers.

examples: Italian coffee, like espresso and cappuccino, is enjoyed all around the world.

The Persian opened the door.
words.defineEn: related to Iran, its language, or people

examples: The Japanese company is light years ahead of its European competitors.

examples: Her credit card bills are enormous!
